file_content.text: First the nobles, now the bugs--let's be done with this planet.
Lieutenant. Chanya Medaal of the Order of Extermination sent me.
My lord. Holocoms are online; we'll put you through.
Sir. Holocoms are online; we'll put you through.
This is Serjay Thul on the eastern front; we're dealing with another Organa attack. How do we fare against the Killiks?
Your team managed to disrupt the war mind of the Black Hive.
Your ally managed to disrupt the war mind of the Black Hive.
Is that right?
I am grateful to you. The Joiners were the key, and you risked body and spirit to stop them.
That's your news on the Killiks. What about the battle for the throne?
How's the fight going, Serjay?
The Republic continues to supply the enemy; it will be Thul and her allies against Organa's coalition before long, but we will prevail.
No sacrifice is too great to save this planet from the Killiks.
I'd do anything for Alderaan.
In the name of the First Huntsman and his sons.
I've proven myself to far more powerful people than you. It's time you recognized that.
You shouldn't doubt me.
You're right.
I'm tremendously grateful for all you've done. It's becoming clear that House Thul is the only house devoted to the Killiks' elimination.
I'll continue advising your teams, Lord Serjay. Chanya out.
You're winning the hearts of the people. Pity she may be trouble.
She's part of a dying order, desperate for our help and recognition. I doubt she'll turn on us.
Chanya is harmless enough.
Perhaps. We can discuss it another time.
I'm not sure I understand.
She knows too much about our capabilities, and her loyalties lie elsewhere--but put that aside for now.
The Killiks are weakened, and soon the Black Nest will fall. After that, Chanya Medaal will be unnecessary.
We won't need her much longer.
True enough.
Wipe the remnants of the Killik forces off the planet, and watch for the other houses--the fewer the bugs, the more they'll encroach.
How many of those bugs are there?
